Partition with indexihasairows fromA. You are given two tables, A and B, each divided into partitions. Table A has $m$ partitions, with the $i$-th partition containing $a_i$ rows. Table B has $n$ partitions, with the $i$-th partition containing $b_i$ rows.

You can move one row from any partition to any other partition in a single operation.  

Find the minimum number of operations needed to ensure that for every row in table A and every row in table B, there is a single partition containing both rows.

You have two sets of data, each divided into multiple groups.  You need to move data between the groups so that each piece of data from the first set is paired with a piece of data from the second set in the same group. Find the fewest moves needed to do this.
